stories.headline: Analyzing School Analysis
stories.summary: The Detroit Free Press decided not to rank schools based solely on test scores, acknowledging the impact of external factors like poverty. The article discusses the media's broader trend of detailed school report cards.

stories.headline: Car-Cooking Raw Numbers
stories.summary: Newspapers in New York analyze the correlation between poverty and school performance using statistical methods to provide context to standardized test scores.

stories.headline: Assessing the E-Rate
stories.summary: Exploration of the E-rate initiative from the Telecommunications Act of 1996, revealing disparities in how different areas benefit from technology funding.

stories.headline: A Few Good CARs
stories.summary: Examining the integration of computer-assisted reporting (CAR) skills in journalism education and its impacts on newsroom practices.

stories.headline: Multi-layered Ratings
stories.summary: The Arkansas Democrat-Gazette publishes a comprehensive statistical report on local schools to aid readers in making informed educational choices.
